lines.text: Oh my lucky stars! A Negro!
Now hold on, hold on just a minute! In the first place I do not fall in love with weirdos who I've only known for four or five days!
Yes you do.
And I don't fall in love with grown men who collect baseball cards!
Yes you do.
Or pee in their pants when they see the ocean!
Yes you do.
Or have perfect table manners!

You know, I asked him about that. He said, good manners are just a way of showing other people we have respect for them. See, I didn't know that, I thought it was just a way of acting all superior. Oh and you know what else he told me?
What?
He thinks I'm a gentleman and you're a lady.

[disgusted]
Well, consider the source! I don't even know what a lady is.

I know, I mean I thought a "gentleman" was somebody that owned horses. But it turns out, his short and simple definition of a lady or a gentleman is, someone who always tries to make sure the people around him or her are as comfortable as possible.
Where do you think he got all that information?
From the oddest place - his parents. I mean, I don't think I got that memo from mine.
Manners are a way of showing other people we care about them.
So for four thousand dollars, all I have to do is drive you to your hotel?
Uh-huh!
That's it?
Yes.
And I don't have to take a physical in your spaceship?
[the doors have unlocked, and Helen and Adam are thrilled; Calvin slightly less so]
Do we just go on up?
No, son. Now is the time we must be at our most cautious. We wait for night.
Oh, shit!
[Helen, realizing Adam has heard her, immediately covers her mouth]
Helen Thomas Webber! Maybe we have been down here a little too long. Pardon her French, son.
"Shit" is French?

[uncomfortably]
Well, it's archaic French. It's a sixteenth century colloquialism, meaning, roughly, good.
Your father's right.
Well. "Shit"!
Where are you parked?
I came on a bus.
Why does that not surprise me.
I dunno. Why doesn't that sunrise you?
Well, I guess because I'm a little psychic. I have this thing.
Oh, that's nice.

Yeah, let me guess something. This is your first visit to La-La-Land. You're staying somewhere in Hollywood because like an idiot you thought that would be an exciting place to stay. Am I right so far?
So far?
Yes, I'm right?
Right.
I knew it. So anyhow, you get on a bus and before you know it you're stuck in the San Fernando Valley without a clue, which brings us to here. Correct again?
Again.
Where are you staying? The Holiday Inn.
Oh. Yes! Yes! The Holiday Inn. That's exactly right.
See, I'm psychic. I mean not completely but pretty much. Pretty good, huh?
No, that was amazing!
Yeah I know. Thanks.
Oh, you coward.
Gentleman coward.
[Adam has bought rollerblades]
Eve, can I skate around your block?

[suggestively]
How about it, Eve - can he *skate* around your block?
No.
Just a few laps.
It won't take long.
No.
I love sushi.
I love Lucy.
Who doesn't? She's hilarious.
Say, mom?
Yes, dear?

I was wondering, you know, while I was up there and all, I was thinking, well you know, I was wondering if maybe I could meet a girl? I've been thinking about that a little. Just these last fifteen years or so.

Oh Adam, it would be wonderful if you could meet a girl. One who's not a mutant and hopefully comes from Pasadena. Nothing against Valley girls but in my day anyhow girls from Pasadena, I don't know, just always seemed a little bit nicer.
Lying can be a very effective dating tool.

[to Adam, about Troy]
He's gay, by the way.

[thinking she means that Troy is happy]
Well, good for you!

Uh, Eve, this is Adam. Look, I just wanted to thank you for everything you did for me. And I wanted to tell you that I... that uh... that I wish so many good things for you. I wish so hard that all of your dreams come true, and... and that's all I... and that's all.
What have you been doing?
Watching television... in color.
Have you ever had sex before?
No.
How is that possible?
What kind of wife are you looking for?
Oh um, well... one who's not a mutant.

[laughs]
No dogs, huh. OK. Cool.
And if it's possible, I'd like to marry someone from Pasadena.

[laughs]
Um, when do you need her by?
Two weeks?
Well, I can probably get you laid in two weeks, but to locate a non-mutant wife from Pasadena takes some time.
That's what I was afraid of.
What do mean you can get me laid?
Uh, can we talk about that a little later?
Of course.
Great.

[Trying to get rid of Troy]
You! Go to the bathroom!
What, right *here*?
[pause while Eve stares at him]
Well I thought I should check, you're being so bossy!
You have a wonderful sense of humor, son, I must say. The acorn does not fall far from the tree.
Son. Adam.
Yes, Father?
stay out of the adult bookstore.
Adult bookstore. Why?
Poison gas. Invisible.
no strangers in the car.
Well if it will make you feel any better, I don't have a gun.
Oh, well that changes everything.

[pointing to Sophie's sizeable breast implants]
So, Sophie, when you fly to Paris, do you check these or are they carry-on?
Eve, a man walks into your life, who's the kindest, most polite, most incredibly rich guy you've ever met...
And I have him committed.
Yes. Yes you did.
Well, at least I fell for him before I knew he was rich. That's new.
I think I'm being chased by a psychiatrist.
It happens.
The sky!
I see it mommy!
I've never seen anything like it!
[looks at little girl]
or like you!
And now I suppose he's trying to make those two dancers feel as comfortable as possible.
No. He didn't go home with them.

[Eve gives a happy look to Troy]
... Well.
He went home with Sophie.

[screams really loudly]
No!
Yep.
No!
She swept him out of the room, whispering little sweet French nothings into his ear.
[Adam, Eve and Troy are at the club, looking for a girlfriend for Adam. Adam spots a lovely young woman]
How about her?
No way.
No way? Why not? I, I think she's very attractive.
Adam! She's got 'bitch' written all over her. You do know what 'bitch' means, don't you?

[nodding]
Well, well, yes, I do. I do have a dictionary. But I can't understand for the life of me why you would say that about her. Or why Cliff would say that about *you*!
[Troy stifles a laugh; Eve glares at him and then at Adam]
[Adam is rehearsing Troy's advice as he approaches a young woman whom Troy thinks looks "sweet."]
Surprising, yet funny.
[Adam recalls his father's silly joke]
Well, I know a duck who bought some lip balm.

[nods to himself]
Lie.
[he approaches Miss Sweet]
Hi.
[she looks him up and down, appraising, but replies disdainfully]
Yes?
I was wondering if you could help me? I, um...
[she looks at him with definite disdain]
...seem to have lost my Congressional Medal of Honor around here... somewhere.

[bursts into laughter]
Now, that's a great one!
Whenever Adam gives me, such obviously incorrect information. I just smile, slap him on the knee and look out the window. Why spoil his dreams? They're such wonderful dreams.
What's baseball?
It's a game, son. I can explain it pretty easily. See, there's a pitcher...
Oh, like a painting.
No, a pitch-er.
Like one of mom's?
No. There's a man who throws the ball to a man who has a bat.
Oh! The nocturnal flying mammal?

[to Adam and Eve]
You guys are gonna have a great time together! Mazel-fucking-tov!
Would you like a tranquilizer?
You have tranquilizers?
I told you, I have everything!
[Calvin is reassuring his wife on their son's first night away from home]
I just want to say, I think he's going to be fine.
Thank you, Calvin, thank you very much.
He's smart!
Yes, dear, I know, but he's still such a baby.
He's a man.
He's a baby man.
Here ya go, one champagne cocktail.
Oh, thank you.
I thought only hookers drank those things?
Well, I know Mom sure likes 'em.

[During his first visit back home]
Mom, I think I'm being chased by a Psychiatrist.
Oh no!
That happens.
I'm sick of working for that dickhead.
What?
You know, a walking penis capable of intelligent speech. A dickhead!
[Edited TV Version]
You know why you can't keep a gosh darn job? Because you can't keep your gosh darn mouth shut! That's why!
